title: Strengthening Service Quality Practical Competencies: Multi-Objective Bayesian Optimization for Material Design Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental materials science and optimization theory
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can systematically explore material design spaces by applying Bayesian Optimization (BO) frameworks under multi-objective and constrained conditions.
Learners can derive optimal alloy combinations using ductility indicators (Pugh ratio, Cauchy pressure) based on Density Functional Theory (DFT).
Learners can complete and apply learning content through a PBL-based real-world Mo-Nb-Ti-V-W alloy system design project.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
